ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc88:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc88:1.2_0: the nuns from the group of six were bathing with scents and colors.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc88:1.3_0: People complained and criticized the monks,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc88:1.4_0: “How can nuns bathe with scents and colors? They are just like householders who indulge in worldly pleasures!”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc88:1.5_0: Nuns heard the complaints of those people,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc88:1.6_0: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc88:1.7_0: “How can the nuns from the group of six bathe with scents and colors?” ...
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc88:1.8_0: “Is it true, monks, that those nuns do this?”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc88:1.11_0: “... How can the nuns from the group of six do this?
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc88:1.12_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc88:1.13_0: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc88:1.14.1_0: ‘If a nun bathes with scents and colors, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc88:2.1.4_0: ...The nun who has been given the full ordination by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc88:2.1.10_0: if he bathes, then for the effort there is an act of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc88:2.2.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc88:2.2.4_0: if she is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc88:2.2.5_0: The fifth training rule is finished.
